sen.j: 迦邇米雷王（かにめいかずちのみこ、生没年不詳）は、『古事記』に伝える古墳時代の皇族（王族）。
sen.e: Prince Kanimeikazuchi [(迦邇米雷王) Kanimeikazuchi no Miko; his date of birth and death are unknown] first appeared in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) as an Imperial family (royal family) during the Kofun period (tumulus period) in Japan.

Prince Kanimeikazuchi (Kanimeikazuchi no Miko; his date of birth and death are unknown) was a member of an Imperial family (royal family) during the Kofun period (tumulus period) appeared in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters).

Prince Kanimeikazuchi (Kanimeikazuchi no Miko; his date of birth and death are unknown) was a member of an Imperial family (royal family) during the Kofun period (tumulus period) appeared in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters).

sen.j: 稚筒城王（『帝王系図』）・若角城命とも。
sen.e: Also, Prince Kanimeikazuchi (迦邇米雷王) was written in different ways such as: "稚筒城王 [appeared in "Teio Keizu" (genealogical table of emperor)] and "若角城命" (appeared in other documents).
Also, Prince Kanimeikazuchi (迦邇米雷王) was written in different ways such as: "稚筒城王 (appeared in "Teio Keizu" [genealogical table of emperor]) and "若角城命."
Also, Prince Kanimeikazuchi (迦邇米雷王) was written in different ways such as: 稚筒城王 (appeared in "Teio Keizu" [genealogical table of emperor]) and 若角城命.

sen.j: 『古事記』によれば、父は山代之大筒木真若王で、母は伊理泥王の女・丹波能阿治佐波毘売（たにわのあじさわびめ）。
sen.e: According to the "Kojiki," the father of Prince Kanimeikazuchi was 'Prince Yamashirono Ootsutsukimawaka' (山代之大筒木真若王), and the mother of Prince Kanimeikazuchi was 'Taniwa no Ajisawabime' (丹波能阿治佐波毘売) who was a daughter of 'Irine no Miko' (伊理泥王).

According to the "Kojiki," the father of Prince Kanimeikazuchi was Prince Yamashirono Ootsutsukimawaka, and the mother of Prince Kanimeikazuchi was Taniwa no Ajisawabim' who was a daughter of Irine no Miko.
sen.cmt: シングルクオートの削除しました。
sen.e: According to the "Kojiki," the father of Prince Kanimeikazuchi was Prince Yamashirono Ootsutsukimawaka, and the mother of Prince Kanimeikazuchi was Taniwa no Ajisawabime who was a daughter of Irine no Miko.

sen.j: また、彦坐王の孫、すなわち開化天皇の曾孫に当たる。
sen.e: Further more, Prince Kanimeikazuchi was the grandson of Prince Hikoimasu (彦坐王), in other words, he was a great-grandchild of the Emperor Kaika.
Furthermore, Prince Kanimeikazuchi was the grandson of Prince Hikoimasu, in other words, he was a great-grandchild of the Emperor Kaika.
Furthermore, Prince Kanimeikazuchi was the grandson of Prince Hikoimasu, in other words, he was a great-grandchild of the Emperor Kaika.

sen.j: 外祖父の伊理泥王は山代之大筒木真若王の同母弟ゆえ、父と母は伯父・姪の続柄になる。
sen.e: Irine no Miko,' the maternal grandfather of 'Kanimeikazuchi no Miko,' was the younger maternal half brother of 'Prince Yamashirono Ootsutsukimawaka'; this would result in the father and the mother of Prince Kanimeikazuchi, having been related as an uncle to a niece.

Since Irine no Miko, the maternal grandfather of Kanimeikazuchi no Miko, was the younger maternal half-brother of Prince Yamashirono Ootsutsukimawaka, his father and mother were in the relationship between an uncle and a niece.
sen.cmt: シングルクオートの削除、ハイフンの追加をし、文を簡略化しました。
sen.e: Since Irine no Miko, the maternal grandfather of Kanimeikazuchi no Miko, was the younger maternal half-brother of Prince Yamashirono Ootsutsukimawaka, his father and mother were in the relationship between an uncle and a niece.

sen.j: 迦邇米雷王は丹波之遠津臣の女・高材比売（たかきひめ）を妃とし、息長宿禰王（おきながのすくねのみこ、気長宿禰王）を儲けた。
sen.e: Prince Kanimeikazuchi married Takakihime (高材比売), a daughter of 'Taniha no Towotsu Omi' (丹波之遠津臣), as his princess; and then she gave birth to a son (prince),'Prince Okinaga no Sukune' [(息長宿禰) Okinaga no Sukune no Miko; he was also known as 'Okinaga no Sukune no Okimi (or Miko)' (気長宿禰王)].

Prince Kanimeikazuchi married Takakihime, a daughter of Taniha no Towotsu Omi, as his princess; and then she gave birth to a son (prince), Prince Okinaga no Sukune (Okinaga no Sukune no Miko; he was also known as Okinaga no Sukune no Okimi [or Miko]).
sen.cmt: シングルクオートの削除、()と[]の訂正をしました。
sen.e: Prince Kanimeikazuchi married Takakihime, a daughter of Taniha no Towotsu Omi, as his princess; and then she gave birth to a son (prince), Prince Okinaga no Sukune (Okinaga no Sukune no Miko; he was also known as Okinaga no Sukune no Okimi [or Miko]).

sen.j: 息長宿禰王は神功皇后の父である。
sen.e: Later, 'Prince Okinaga no Sukune' was to become the father of the Empress Jingu,
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Later, Prince Okinaga no Sukune became the father of the Empress Jingu,
sen.cmt: was to become→becameとシングルクオートの削除しました。
sen.e: Later, Prince Okinaga no Sukune became the father of the Empress Jingu,

sen.j: 他、2人の王子は近江国国造・吉備国品治国造・但馬国国造の祖と伝えられる。
sen.e: Then, two of his sons (princes) were considered to be ancestors of 'Omino kuni no miyatsuko' (近江国国造), 'Kibi no kuni Honji kunino miyatsuko' (吉備国品治国造), and 'Tajima no kunino miyatsuko' (但馬国国造).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: His two other sons (princes) were considered to be ancestors of Omino kuni no miyatsuko, Kibi no kuni Honji kunino miyatsuko, and Tajima no kunino miyatsuko.
sen.cmt: 最初の部分の変更とシングルクオートの削除しました。
sen.e: His two other sons (princes) were considered to be ancestors of Omino kuni no miyatsuko, Kibi no kuni Honji kunino miyatsuko, and Tajima no kunino miyatsuko.

sen.j: なお、迦邇米雷王は京都府京田辺市・朱智神社の主祭神であるという。
sen.e: Additionally, Prince Kanimeikazuchi had been the shusaijin (main enshrined deities) of the Suchi-jinja Shrine, which is located in Kyotanabe City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Additionally, Prince Kanimeikazuchi had been the shusaijin (main enshrined deities) of the Suchi-jinja Shrine, which is located in Kyotanabe City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Additionally, Prince Kanimeikazuchi had been the shusaijin (main enshrined deities) of the Suchi-jinja Shrine, which is located in Kyotanabe City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 子孫は朱智姓を名乗ったという。
sen.e: Then, offspring of Prince Kanimeikazuchi seemed to assume the surname "Suchi."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Then, offspring of Prince Kanimeikazuchi seemed to assume the surname "Suchi."
Then, offspring of Prince Kanimeikazuchi seemed to assume the surname "Suchi."
